title: The Renormalisation Group Equation As An Equation For Lie Transport Of Amplitudes
abstract: It is shown that the renormalisation group (RG) equation can be viewed as an equation for Lie transport of physical amplitudes along the integral curves generated by the $\beta$-functions of a quantum field theory. The anomalous dimensions arise from Lie transport of basis vectors on the space of couplings. The RG equation can be interpreted as relating a particular diffeomorphism of flat space-(time), that of dilations, to a diffeomorphism on the space of couplings generated by the vector field associated with the $\beta$-functions.
